inn1.comm: short of a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, Tharanga looks to turn this to leg, and is slightly early into it
wide down leg side, swinging further away after passing the stumps. Sarfraz has to make a diving save
loose flirty shot outside off. Short of a length, wide already, angling away, and he follows it without any feet. Beaten
on the pads again, too straight. Pitched outside leg, angling towards leg, and even though Tharanga doesn't get any bat on it, four leg-byes accrue
that's better, pitched on leg, angling towards off, Tharanga is squared up in defence
short of a length, just outside off, punched away to cover-point
first runs off the bat. Short of a length again, but this provides him the width. Tharanga follows it, and opens the face late to place it between point and cover-point
length ball, just outside off, seaming away, left alone
another delivery wide enough to not make Dilshan play
better. Length ball, not too wide, Dilshan fancies a drive, and is beaten by the seam movement
another delivery seaming away from just outside off. Dilshan is well forward before shouldering arms
slightly shorter, but Dilshan is not following them outside off
Tanvir begins with a maiden. Length ball, well outside off, left alone
length ball, accurate, no room outside off, defended to mid-off

a sharp slip catch by Younis. Loose shot from Tharanga. Short of a length, outside off, holding the line a bit if anything, and Tharanga drives at it without any foot movement. It's a healthy edge to the left of second slip, and YK is alert there
angling in towards off, Sanga defends it solidly to leg
dug in short, chest-high, outside off, keeps it down with a solid back-foot defensive
fuller, angling in towards top of off, Sanga defends off the front foot

Afridi misfields. That's a rare occurrence. This is a full ball into the pads, Sanga turns the bat face too early, and gets a leading edge towards mid-on, where Afridi sort of dives over the ball, and allows two runs. Should have stopped that, and kept this over down to a maiden

Afridi again. This is push-driven nicely between the bowler and Afridi, and Afridi doesn't give the chase, presuming the ball is headed for the boundary. To his horror, the ball holds up inside, and they take three
and now Tanvir slips one down the pads of the left-hand batsman
this one swings away from the left-hand batsman, but wide enough for Sanga to not play at
another good delivery. Short of a length, just outside off, moving away, defended with an open face
slightly short, slightly wide, cut away to third man for one
length ball outside off, left alone to seam away
Shot. He has had a sighter, and now goes after one. Length again, widish again, and he plants the front foot down to drive it at the top of the bounce. Through extra cover it goes

oh what a ripper. Short of a length, pitching just outside off, Sanga has to play and cover the angle. And then the ball leaves him. Can't do much with these, except hope you don't edge it, which is what happened
Overthrow. Steered away to third man, and Tanvir's throw from there hits the stumps direct, and the deflection gets them a second
drives outside off, gets an inside edge to fine leg
short of a length, angling in towards middle, defended back to him
flashy drive outside off, doesn't connect well, and is fielded at cover-point
length, on off, defended to cover-point
short of a length, angling in, defended towards cover-point
lovely delivery. Pitches this up, swinging in towards off and middle, gets the inside edge onto the pad
tries the one that swings the other way, but this starts too wide, and takes the best of Sarfraz to keep this from going for byes
this one is slightly slower, 133ks, angling into the stumps, takes the inside edge, and Sanga comes back for two

slower ball, and Tanvir can't believe he is not given out. Bowled from close to the stumps, on a length, just outside off, beats the inside edge, hits him flush in front, just above the roll, on the crease, and he is not given out by Umpire Martinesz. That's very very close
angling into the pads, and worked away for one
gets this one leave him against the angle. Left alone
angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the front foot
angling in towards middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
length ball, angling in towards the top of off, Sanga solidly behind it
left alone outside off to finish the second maiden of the innings
heavy ball. On a length, angling in, hits the sticker of the bat. One hand comes off the bat
angling in again, defended to midwicket
lovely delivery. Leaving him against the angle, bouncing too, beating the cut
angling in this time, defended off the back foot
angling in, but well outside off, and is left alone
this one holds its line outside off, and is left alone
thick edge as he pushes at one outside off, and he gets a single to third man
short of a length, into the pads, worked to square leg, wants a single, is sent back. Rightly too
Another beauty from Gul. On a length, outside off, Dilshan wants a big, booming drive, but the ball holds its line, and beats the outside edge
another delivery that holds its line, and all the pressure has resulted in a risky single. Thick edge to point, Sanga calls him through, and Umar Akmal's throw misses. Had he hit, Sanga was a goner
short of a length, angling in, defended to cover
nice shot. Length ball, angling in, Sanga moves inside the line, and flicks this between square leg and midwicket
another length ball that holds its line outside off, pushed to cover
yorker down the leg side, goes off the toe for a leg-bye
this one moves against the angle, but has started outside leg, and is called a wide
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
moves away after pitching just outside off, defended to leg
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length, angling in, pushed to square leg
short and wide first ball, and is cut away square of sweeper-cover for a couple
short and wide again, and this time Dilshan delays the cut even more to go so square of backward point. This one goes for four
short and wide again, and luckily for Afridi this time he finds point
now the slider, fuller too, gets the inside edge, but it is safe
tossed up now, 86ks, defended back to Afridi
slow and teasing again, 89ks, driven down to long-off for one
swing right away, but it starts wide, and is called too
full and straight, pushed into the stumps at the non-striker's end
length ball, outside off, 118ks, punched to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended to leg
angled too far outside off. Younis not happy with the wide call, especially because Sanga has walked down and across. That call was a touch harsh
walks down and across again, pushes this to long-off for one
sliding down leg, worked away to fine leg
length ball outside off, left alone
Afridi teasing him again. Flighted on middle and leg, 83ks, hits the pad
steps out of the crease to drive this to long-on for one
short again, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
comes down the wicket and drives this to long-off for one
flighted outside off, Sanga plays for the turn, this one slides away with the angle, and beats the outside edge
stays back to defend a length ball back to him
another wide from Younis
pushed to straight extra cover, and Afridi tries to sneak in a run-out. Concedes an overthrow
Sanga pushes outside off, gets an inside edge that beats the stumps
short of a length, on off, pushed to straight extra cover
wide and full, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, on off, worked wide of midwicket for one
length ball, outside off, solidly pushed to cover
flighted on middle and leg, slides down as Dilshan plays for the turn. Beaten
full, fast and wide, 95ks, and beats Dilshan's drive
slows it down now, 80ks, but bowls a touch short, and is punched away to sweeper-cover
chips down the track, works this length ball to deep midwicket for one
flat, shortish, late-cuts it, but can't beat point
hat's the risky cut. Quick delivery, angling in towards off, he plays the cut, and just about manages to keep it out
short and wide, and Sanga cashes in with a cut. Poor start from Ajmal. Fifty for the partnership
length ball now, slight turn away after pitching on off, defended to leg
fired in again, 91ks, worked away off the pads
length ball, on off, 87ks, defended to cover
quicker, straighter, 89ks, worked away to deep midwicket
Sanga is sleepwalking here. Worked away straight to square leg, and he ambles up for a single. Dilshan sends him back, and he just about makes it back in time

Hafeez's golden arm strikes first ball. Premeditated sweep first ball. Dilshan misses the ball completely. On a length, just outside off, turning in slightly, hits him in front of middle and off. That's dead plumb
flighted outside off, defended
full, driven to long-on for one
on a length, in front of off, defended back to him
offbreak, middle and off, turning towards off, defended off the back foot
quick offbreak on off, 87ks, defended to extra cover
turning into the pads, pushed to square leg
patting a burning dog there, cutting a quick offbreak. This is bowled at 90ks, on a length, and he is playing the cut. Just about keeps this out
turning into the pads, defended to square leg
topspinner now, 91ks, on middle and leg, defended to leg again
flighted offbreak outside off, Ajmal runs to his right to prevent the single to long-on
quick offbreak, 92ks, beats him, but this is turning down the leg side
Huge lbw appeal. Pitches middle, and doesn't turn enough to get the verdict. But the pressure is one
defended to leg
offbreak, slower through the air, defended off the front foot again
jumps out of the crease, is beaten in the flight, and kicks it away
out of the crease again, pushes this to midwicket
comes down the track again, works this length ball behind square on the leg side for the first run in 15 deliveries
offbreak, on off, defended solidly
length ball outside off, 91ks, defended with an open face
chips down the track again, pushes this full ball to long-on for one
Dangerous premeditated sweep, and he is beaten. But he has just got outside the line of off

full offbreak, pushed straight to mid-off, and substitute Rehman misses from there. The only time I have seen Pakistan hit the stumps is that throw from Tanvir from third man, which conceded an overthrow
defended in front of off
flighted outside off, pushed to mid-off
Chandimal takes the risk, comes down the track, not quite to the pitch of the ball, doesn't quite get the elevation, but he has hit this between the bowler and mid-off
full, and driven to long-on for one
slow through the air, a full toss, 86ks, pushed back to him
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
full again, driven to long-on for another single
doosra, opens the face on it, places it past slip for one
shorter, flatter, quicker, pushed to midwicket
full offbreak, gets a thick edge towards point
straighter, non-turner, pushed back to him
comes down the track, is beaten in the flight, and kicks the ball away
shorter, 93ks, cut away, but finds point
starts with a quick legbreak, at 95ks, defended to cover
slower, but a legbreak again, 87ks, defended off the back foot
full, sliding one, gets a thick inside edge, wide of midwicket
another misfield. This is worked towards square leg, where the fielder dives over it, allowing a single
slides this down the leg for a wide
slow legbreak, 84ks, on off, defended solidly
full and fast, 96ks, dug out to long-on for one
turning into middle and leg, worked to square leg
short and straight, punched down to long-on for one
no turn on this shortish delivery, punched down to long-on for one
full and fast, 90ks, pushed to long-on for one
stays back to play this length ball to straight extra cover
offbreak, pushed to the left of extra cover for a single
legbreak on the pads, pushed straight to Younis at square leg, sent back
slider, in front of off, pushed between point and short third for a single
slog-sweep. Calculated risk to break the streak of tight overs. Drags this from outside off, and goes over the midwicket
legbreak wide outside off, defended to cover
slow now, 85ks, defended to cover again
angling into the pads, worked away for a single
length ball on the pads, worked to square leg
another sharp offbreak, hits him on the pad

Two dots and gone. Chandi feels like he needs to do something extraordinary. Looks to make room and cut a length ball, and Hafeez hits the off stump. Chandimal really does show the pressure if you can block his singles
off the mark right away, pushing this offbreak to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
topspinner, middle and leg, Mahela gets inside the line, and works this behind square on the leg side
legbreak, looks to back-cut, can't beat point
full, on the pads, worked away
short of a length, quick, pushed to cover

lovely delivery, and hits Sarfraz on the head. Slower through the air, on a length, on off, turns and bounces, takes the edge onto the pad, and then onto the coconut. No cut or gash. No helmet even. Strangely, ruled a bye
quicker, shorter, looks to late-cut, finds short third man
quick, into the pads, the deflection goes to short fine leg
full, on off, pushed back to him
slower through the air, slight bite off the pitch again, pushed to long-off for one
chips down the track, and chips this to long-on for one. Wanted to hit wide of long-on, but couldn't place it
full and straight, defended back to Hafeez
length ball, accurate, pushed to point where Afridi anticipates a single, and denies it through quick work
another dab to point, and Afridi is alert again
full, on the pads, worked straight to midwicket
flighted outside off, turning away, defended with an open face
quicker legbreak, 102ks, Mahela opens the face, and still can't beat short third man
full outside off, driven to extra cover
full, on off, chipped towards long-on, where a fumble form Gul turns a sharp second into an easy one
plays for the turn, but the ball drifts in, and he hits it uppishly towards the vacant mid-on region
the scoop. Down on a knee, in front of the stumps, and lobs this length ball over the keeper's head
tries the reverse sweep, and is beaten by a quick ball outside off
length ball, on the pads, uppishly placed wide of midwicket for one
topspinner, no room, stays back to keep it out
leaves the crease, beaten in the flight, kicks it away
sharp offbreak, Sanga goes back to a length ball, and is beaten by the turn
full, into the pads, gets a single off the inside edge
takes the risk. Moves well across the stumps, Afridi bowls fastish, 95ks, and then he laps this full ball from in front of leg, gets a couple
flighted outside off, defended to cover
slider, pitches leg, angles towards off, Sanga opens the face, gets it to bounce in front of the keeper, and Sarf makes dive wide to prevent the single
Dropped. Sitter at long-on. And it's Gul. Sanga shows desperation by coming down the track and lofting this straight to Gul. Gul gets down on a knee, tries to take it low, but spills it
big appeal for lbw, but this is clearly headed down leg. A slider
this will rub salt for Afridi. Two balls after being dropped off Afridi, Sanga despatches a long hop over midwicket
full, middle and off, driven to long-off for one
mis-hits a reverse-sweep in front of square, gets a single
comes down the track, works a length ball around the corner
flighted on middle and leg, worked away for a single
length ball, just outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
sweeps a really full ball to deep square leg for a single
slower through the air, tries the lap shot, mis-times, and Ajmal is caught napping at short fine leg
flighted on middle and leg, this time Younis is alert at short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
tries the late-cut again, and fins short third man again
tries the scoop over the keeper's head this time, is beaten by a full ball, and is hit on the pad outside the line of off
length ball, on off, played with the turn, gets a single to sweeper-cover
tries the late-cut again, and is beaten by the ball angled across him
worked off the pads for a single
short of a length, finds the only fielder in the circle on the leg side, Younis at midwicket
length ball on off now, pushed back to him
length ball, angling in towards off, punched down to long-off for one
full, on off, thick-edged to point
full on off, driven to long-off for one
chipped away towards long-off, falls well short of Gul
quicker one, angling across him, 98ks, takes the leading edge towards short third man
short of a length, goes back to work it towards deep midwicket for one
quicker ball, angled in for top of off, Mahela defends off the front foot
gets inside the line of a length ball, works it wide of short fine leg, reaches 50 off 99 balls. Sanga is not too pumped, he knows there is work left to do
length ball, on the pads, helped around the corner for a single
full, on off, driven back to Ajmal
tospinner, just outside off, Sanga cramped on the drive, hits it to cover
nice shot. Calculated risk. Makes room, takes this length ball from outside leg, goes inside-out, and clears extra cover, not by much, but clears nonetheless
angling into the pads, helped away for a single behind square
Gul, who dropped Sanga, pays the heftiest of prices. No respect shown to him. Dances down to a length ball, and lofts him over long-on as if a spinner
wide down the leg side now
short of a length, into the body, worked away into the on side for the 50th run of the stand
another wide down the leg side, except this has slid down the pads of a right-hand batsman
short of a length, not much room, Mahela wants to run it fine, and is beaten. Slightly late into the shot
short again, plays the regulation cut now, gets a single to deep point
slower ball, driven nicely, but Hafeez is quick at extra cover, denies them even a single
good bouncer, follows his head as he backs away, and Sanga drops out of the way at the last moment
tries the reverse-sweep, and Ajmal fires this down what would have been his leg stump. Not called a wide by the umpire
this time plays the regulation lap, and takes this quick ball from outside leg, and guides this virtually over the keeper's head
length ball, on leg, worked away for a single to deep square
length ball, middle and leg, driven to long-off
full, outside off, angling away, beats him open face
that's right-arm filth, full, fast, well outside leg, at 102ks, and all Mahela has to do is get some bat, and boy he does. Past short fine leg it goes
Sanga makes room, Gul follows him with a bouncer, but the top edge doesn't carry to deep square leg
yorker, good old-fashioned yorker, swinging in towards off, dug out to Hafeez at midwicket
short and wide, and he has murdered this cut shot. Never mind the presence of deep point, nothing is coming in the way of that one
short again, this time MJ pulls, bottom-edges it towards midwicket, sneaks in a single
bouncer again. Too predictable. Third bouncer in a row to Sanga. He moves inside the line, and pulls this in the air, using all of Gul's pace, lofting it behind square
top shot. Slower ball, following him, short of a length, but even as he moves backwards, Sanga punches this inside-out, from well outside leg, between mid-off and extra cover
reverse-pull for a one-bounce four. Mahela shapes up for the reverse-sweep, Ajmal drops short, Mahela stands upright again, and pulls him over point. Nearly carried all the way
regulation sweep for a single
short of a length, punched straight to extra cover
slower through the air, 92ks, middle and leg, pushed to the right of Ajmal, and he makes a diving save
nearly played on. Sanga backs away a long away, Ajmal bowls an offbreak on leg, and it turns away fast from Sanga. The bottom edge misses the stumps narrowly
doosra outside off, Mahela plays the forward-defensive
full, straight, pushed back to him
angled into the pads, worked towards deep midwicket, gets one, slips while turning, so has to stay content with one
tries the big sweep, mis-hits it for a single to deep square
topspinner, on off, cramping him, dabbed away for a single
pauses in the delivery stride, bowls short, pulled in the air, falls short of long-on
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
wide of the crease, angling in, defended back to him
angling in again, cramping him up, dabbed away to third man for one
Sanga is turning it on here. He has scored 33 off the last 20 balls he has faced. He is backing away, takes this slower ball, gets under it, and lofts it over long-off for a six
Sanga gives him the charge, his head falls away, and he is beaten outside off. The ball stays low too
good bouncer, just outside off, umpires are happy this is between shoulders and head, but Sanga feels it should be a wide
short of a length, angling in, punched away for a single to sweeper-cover
Sanga is making room, and in an attempt to follow him, Ajmal drops this short, and he pulls it over midwicket
full, offbreak, middle and off, edged to short third man
Top shot. Sanga is putting up an exhibition here. Backs away again, Ajmal bowls flat again, and he goes inside-out, over extra cover. Lovely batting. Into the 90s
slows this down, middle and leg, worked away for a single to deep square

that's four byes, but it would be pretty harsh on Sarfraz. Mahela hasmoved all over the place here, looking for a reverse-slog, and Sarf is blindsighted. Then it takes the top edge over the keeper's gloves. Still called byes
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
length ball, no room, driven to sweeper-cover for one
he tries to pull this, but is cramped by the angle, and mis-hits it to midwicket
looks for the late-cut again, and he misses again. Mahela backs away again, the angle follows him, and passes over leg. Muted appeal for a catch at the wicket
you can try all the fancy-shmancy slower balls, but I don't know many batsmen who can hit these. Yorker, angling in, headed for the base of the stumps, beats the open face, and uproots the leg pole

throat ball first ball. Perera is on his toes, knocking his head back, fending in front of the body. The ball has hardly gone anywhere, but Sanga calls him through for a single. Tanvir fields, but misses the stumps. He was gone had Tanvir hit
dabbed to point, steals a single, another throw misses the stumps
nice chip shot, over the bowler's head, between long-on and long-off, gets a couple

Azhar has pulled off a blinder. Or has he? They are checking the replays. Pulled towards deep midwicket as Ajmal follows him. Cramped for room, he doesn't make a good connection. Azhar rushes in from deep midwicket, and dives forward to catch a low catch. After many replays and zoom-ins, the umpires are satisfied he got the finger underneath it. Sanga is not too pleased with the decision. Or perhaps he is just upset he missed out on a ton
flighted outside off, played with an open face, towards short third man
offbreak, just short of a length, steaks a single to midwicket, another instance where a direct hit would have resulted in a run-out
as Ajmal cramps him with one that slides in. Replays show it hit the gloves of the batsman, that too well outside the line
cut away for a single to deep cover
slower-ball yorker, outside off, dug out, another dot
length ball, outside off, in the slot, but he misses with the slog. Trying to hit too hard
bouncer, following him, and even though Perera is not watching the ball, and even though that head is falling away, he has connected superbly for four through square leg
wide length ball, trying to create distance as Perera is backing away. Toe-ended through extra cover for one
slower ball, runs off the thick outside edge for a single to third man
slower ball, full outside off, completely mis-hit to long-on for one
fired down the leg side, a wide
Pakistan hold another catch. Perera tries the slog again. Clears the front leg, and swings. Not quite full enough for him, and hence the top edge into the deep on the leg side
short of a length, middle and off, dabbed away for one
full and slow, beats him in the flight, and with the doosra, but he has strayed too far down the leg side, and the deflection off the pad goes for four
short of a length, outside off, punched away for a single
flighted outside off, pushed between cover and extra cover for one
length ball outside off, but he beats Thirimanne for the pace. A touch too quick for the new batsman
looks to pull, beaten for pace again, hit on the pad, takes a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, Mathews happy with those dabs for singles
lovely shot. Short ball, angling in, cramping him up, Thirimanne arches back to create room, and then guides it virtually over the keeper's head
length ball outside off, drives it square, can't beat point, but takes a single
slower ball, middle and leg, drops and runs, takes a single towards cover
Mathews tries his all to get lbw. Goes right across the stumps, whips across the line, but gets an inside edge onto the pad
Thirimanne has slog-swept him for a six. No respect for quick men. And this is right in the slot. On a length, on leg, and he gets down on a knee, and lofts him over midwicket

Finally somebody hits the stumps direct when it matters. Low full toss, near yorker, dug out to point, tries to steal the single, Afridi hits the non-striker's end's stumps down. Beats him by half a frame. On the line when the bail comes off. Afridi is pretty thrilled with this
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, hit straight to Afridi at midwicket, and he tries another run-out. Mathews, who had lost his bat, would have just made it in had Afridi hit
makes room to drive this full to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, angling in, worked around the corner for one
short, Mathews makes room, toe-ends it to extra cover for one
full, on off, stays back to drive it to long-off for one
Misbah saves three. Mathews makes room to drive this inside-out, but Misbah dives to his left at extra cover to keep them down to one
Timber. Short of a length. Kula stays back and swings, aiming for midwicket. Is beaten, and is bowled. This dismissal not only gets Pakistan a dot, it also keeps Mathews off strike for the last ball
good sharp short ball at 133ks to beat Malinga's slog and earn another dot and a four-run over

inn2.comm: starts with a good outswinger, 140ks, starts middle and off, shapes away towards off, defended off the front foot
nice punch as Malinga pitches slightly short, but he finds the fielder at cover
fuller, but slightly wider, and is left alone
short of a length, 143ks, swinging away, pushed to cover

Another duck for Hafeez. Professor has become a duck farmer. Digs this in short. Malinga is a man with a plan. The fine leg is much squarer than regulation, a long leg, and Hafeez goes for the pull in front of his face. And it goes straight down long leg's throat where Kulasekara makes no mistake, as Bob Willis would put it
outswinging yorker, just outside off, dug out for a single to leg
big wide down leg, Sanga saves four runs with a dive
this inswinger is on target, shaping in towards off, defended off the front foot
the straighter one, and it is wide too, and Shafiq goes after it, away from his body, and toe-ends it between cover and cover-point
pitched up again, the straighter one again, left alone outside off
another leave outside off as Kula has now bowled three straight deliveries. Watch out for the big inswinger headed for top of off
there it is, Shafiq covers it well, places it wide of square leg, gets a single
the straighter one outside off, Azhar stretches out feeling for it, and is beaten
full, middle and leg, pushed out to mid-on
slower ball outside off, bounces over the horizontal bat as he pushes at it
wide down the leg side, just gets the line wrong here
length ball, on off, shaping away, defended to leg
bouncer, and unlike Hafeez he ducks under it
slashes at a short-of-a-length delivery, and is beaten by the away movement
short ball, outside off, and pulled away through midwicket for four
Kula starts another over with a leg-side wide. Sanga appeals for a catch, but that's more the bluff we all try to pull off
swinging in towards off stump, defended back to him
leaves the crease to counter the swing, but doesn't quite get close to the delivery, and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
bouncer ow, called wide for the height by the square-leg umpire. MJ can't believe it. Kula has a chat with the umpire at the non-striker's end. Dissent? I don't mind a show of emotion, though
this one holds its line outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, driven to cover
leaves the crease again, Kula bowls short, and also gets it to move away. he does get some bat on it, and steers it to third man for a single
short of a length, 145ks, just outside off, punched away to cover
this is shorter, chest-high, fended towards point
good sharp bouncer, over the stumps, stays inside the line
outswinger, starts just outside off, left alone, stays low too
Top shot. Fuller, closer to off, and he drives it between cover and extra cover. All along the ground
outswinger, starts outside off, left alone
short of a length, nipping back in, rising towards ribs, kept out by him
wide half-volley, crashed away, but he finds cover. Not happy with himself with that placement
big inswinger, beats his attempt at flick, but there is no lbw appeal because this is headed down leg
short of a length, wide, punched away to third man
straighter one, outside off, left alone
half-volley outside off, no feet as he drives, gets the inside half of the bat, to mid-on
lovely legcutter to begin with, short of a length, on off, seams away, beats the edge
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
full, outswinger, driven, but again he finds short cover
legcutter now, Shafiq moves forward, covers the movement, defends to point
half-volley, middle and off, played across the line, gets a couple to deep square leg
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, moving in, pushed to midwicket
short, gives him width, Azhar cuts, between point and cover-point, along the ground
length ball, swinging in, defended off the front foot
length ball outside off, defended to cover
another well timed shot finds a fielder. Short of a length, wide, punched away, but straight to cover
length ball outside off, no movement either way, left alone
length ball, outside off, holds its line, beats the booming drive with that movement
stops a touch at him, 128ks, he pushes this towards mid-off for a quick single. Weerakoon hits from mid-off, but he is well in
length ball, just outside off, covers the off stump, leaves it alone
gives him the charge, Mathews shortens the length a little, Azhar gets an inside edge onto his toe
outswinger, Azhar caught inside the crease, defends in front of his body
leaves the crease again, punches and the connection makes a sweet sound, but he finds mid-off
short and wide, cut away in the air, on the bounce to third man
wide and full, driven to cover
short of a length, flicked away to midwicket
clipped away off the pads, wide of deep square leg
short and wide, misses out, gets a bottom edge into the ground
outswinger, just outside off, just short of driving length, defended off the front foot
walks out of the crease, Mathews sees him coming, bowls wider, and is left alone
length ball, on off, punched down the ground, Mathews gets a touch on it, keeps them down to one
Shot. Shafiq breaks free. They need much more of that. Charges down, takes this on the half-volley, and lofts him over mid-on, against the swing
length ball, into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
outswinger, wide, pushed in front of his body, gets a single to sweeper-cover
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
jumps out of the crease, takes this from outside leg, gets a single to deep square
short, wide, cut away between cover-point and point, Mathews from sweeper-cover gives chase and sticks the boot out to keep them down to three
flat outside off, cut away in front of square
angling into the pads, worked around the corner
comes out of the crease, takes this on half-volley, pushes a single to long-on
length ball, holding its line just outside off, defended with an open face
slower ball, push-driven, Mathews gets a hand to it to take out whatever sting it had
pitched in short, Azhar gets inside the line to pull this fine of long leg where Kula makes a diving save
length ball, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
angling well down leg side, Azhar gets enough pad on it to get four leg-byes
length ball outside off, swinging away a little, he gets an inside edge onto the pad, and steals a single
full, outside off, worked away towards deep midwicket
full, middle and leg, no turn, worked away to deep midwicket again
half-volley again, driven to long-on for one

Weerakoon takes 10 balls to claim his first international wicket. Shafiq will be disappointed he has missed a straight ball especially given Weerakoon hasn't turned any delivery so far. Pitched on a length, just outside off, Shafiq plays for the turn, and his inside edge is beaten by a long way. Hits him on the roll, in front of middle and leg. Given after a long appeal. Weera is thrilled. You have to give him credit. this ball actually slid in a little too
short of a length, middle and off, sliding in, pushed to straight midwicket
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for an easy single
lovely legcutter, short of a length, on off, cutting away, defended wide of cover for one
short of a length, middle and leg, holds its line, gets a leading edge as he looks to work this to leg. Safe
this is angling into the pads, clipped away for a single to deep square leg
inside edge saves him. Short of a length, just outside off, seaming in, but that inside edge prevents the lbw
short of a length, wide, cut away in front of square
length ball, on off, no turn, defended to cover
leaves the crease, beaten in flight, defends in front of his body
premeditates a lap sweep, gets a single to fine leg
tossed up outside off, Misbah tries the reverse-lap, and is beaten
flighted outside off, no turn, defended
stays back to work this short ball away for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched away square
holds its line outside off, beats the drive
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
chips down the track, pushes a length ball to mid-on
gives him the charge and misses a length ball. He just swung at this without any area in mind
short and wide, and he has cut it straight to point
inside edge, that kept really low and Misbah's fortunate, goes for the cut, gets an inside edge and it evades the keeper to roll down the fine-leg boundary
slower one this time, keeping low again, lands on a good length, leaves that one be
short of a good length, taps that one into the off side, wants a single but it isn't there, is sent back wisely

nicely struck, pitched up this time and he offers the full face while driving it back, stopped by Kulasekara on his follow through, tried to deflect it onto the stumps at the non-striker's end and Ali  has to dive to make it back
beaten, goodish length outside off and just a hint of away movement, pokes at that one and is beaten
just in the channel outside off, pushed away in the direction of cover
length ball outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, no room, punched to point
gets slight width, but bottom-edges the intended punch
length ball outside off, pushed straight to mid-off
wide half-volley, gets a single to sweeper-cover
walks down the track, Perera pulls the length back, defended to point again
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man for one
short of a length, holding its line outside off, pushed to cover-point
Lovely shot. Needs singles in between these superb shots. Dances down the track, makes room, takes this on half-volley, and crashes this between extra cover and mid-off. Along the ground
another direct-hit from Sri Lanka, but Misbah has made it. Played with soft hands, dropped towards cover, Misbah stutters, Chandimal hits the stumps at the striker's end, but Misbah is in
gets a thick inside edge as he drives at a length ball, gets a couple to wide of deep square leg
legcutter. Short of a length, just outside off, beats his drive
Misbah is caught sleeping again. Dabbed wide of point, but Misbah thinks it has been hit straight to the man. Belatedly he takes the single
he is wide awake with this one. Short of a length, outside off, and he punches this between point and third man. Superb timing
length ball outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, outside off, bottom-edges a punch
half-volley outside off, wasted with a drive straight to mid-off
length ball, just outside off, driven to mid-off
length ball, on off, no turn, defended
swept from in front of middle stump, gets a single to long leg
lap-swept for a single to fine leg
comes down the track to push this to long-off for one
short, punched to long-on for one
fooled Sanga there. He shapes up for the lap shot, Sanga moves to the leg side, and then he doesn't even get a touch on it. The ball goes between the stumps and Sanga for wides
length ball outside off, defended to cover
swing and miss. Azhar leaves the crease, makes room, tries to go over mid-off, but misses by a good six inches with his head falling away
length ball outside off, pushed to cover
length ball wide outside of, driven straight to cover
punched away between cover and cover-point for a single
walks down the track, steers this shortish delivery for a single to third man
length ball outside off, defended to cover-point
short, middle and leg, punched to long-on for one
leaves the crease, beaten in the flight, hit on the pad, but well down the crease
comes down again, pushes this wide of long-on for two
makes room, moves inside the line - Salim Malik-style - then works a length ball into the leg side
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
length ball on off, pushed to cover, doesn't get a single
short of a length, on off, punched to point
that's Misbah's other personality, the alter ego. Out of nowhere he lofts a length ball over the bowler's head. He is such a clean striker it confounds me he doesn't go faster
Hello... short of a length, pushed back to Perera who throws at the stumps even though Misbah has not left the crease. No damage done
short and wide, cut away powerfully, but finds short cover-point
moves across, pushes a length ball straight to mid-on
sharp bouncer, shoulder-high, Misbah tries the pull, mistimes it, but gets it wide of mid-on
short, worked away for an easy single to deep midwicket
comes down the track, takes this on a half-volley, pushes it for a single to long-on
length ball, outside off, driven to long-off
slower through the air, bunts this into the on side from outside off, gets a single
fullish, on off, driven back to Weera
makes room, drives a full ball to long-off for a single
sliding down the leg side, Misbah misses out, but gets two leg-byes as it deflects softly off the pad, fine of fine leg
length ball, middle and leg, placed wide of midwicket for one
walks down the track, works this length ball into the leg side for a single
full, down leg, clipped away for an easy single
shimmies down the track, wants to drop and run, but he has timed it well to point, and is sent back
sliding down leg, picked away for another easy single
makes room, walks back in front of stumps, gets inside the line, works to the leg side for a single
full on the pads, driven to deep midwicket for one
leaves the crease, Weera pitches this short, sneaks a dot ball in as he can't place this wide of Weera
quicker and straighter, clipped to square leg, another dot
full, on the pads, pushed to long-on for one
Misbah makes the room here, creates the width, gets a short ball, cuts it, but finds point
short of a length, shimmies down, pushes this to point where Thirimanne misfields to allow them a single
short of a length, wide, punched away square of third man for a single
wide length ball, driven square to point. Thirimanne does well this time
shaping in, sliding down, Azhar gets a leg-bye, has to run around Mathews who is appealing for a leg-before. Missing leg clearly
short of a length, this holds its line in front of off. Defended. this dot ball takes the asking rate to six
angling in towards off, tips and runs, takes a single to cover-point
short, not too wide, punched away, Perera makes a diving save at point
full outside off, pushed to cover
short and wide again, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, middle and off, pushed to cover, another dot
comes down the track, takes this on half-volley, pushes it to long-on for one
full on middle and leg, whipped to long-on for one
seaming in from outside off, Misbah pushes to point, wants a single, is sent back, dives for the crease, gets up and takes the overthrow off a wide shot from Thirimanne. All happening
angling into the pads, misses out again, and has to settle for a leg-bye
length ball, accurate, middle and off, pushed back to Mathews
walks down the track, gets a thick edge through vacant slip region as this holds its line
short of a length, on off, wants to drop and run, but doesn't get a single. Hit straight to cover
walks down the wicket, looks to turn this to leg, beaten, hit on the pad, outside the line of off, takes a leg-bye as it deflects wide of cover
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
drives inside-out, gets a single to sweeper-cover
short, into the pads, easy single to deep square leg
full outside off, wristed away to long-on for one
short, middle and leg, pulled wide of long-on, calls for do (two) as soon as it leaves the bat, and comes back easily
walks down the track, places this length ball wide of mid-on for a single
good-looking shot straight to a fielder. makes room, and drives the pants off this full ball, but hits it straight to extra cover
yorker, middle and leg, digs this out, gets a single between cover and point
length ball outside off, driven to extra cover, Chandimal misfields this, lets it through his legs, and Azhar gets a couple to bring up his fifty
pushed wide of mid-on for a single
dabs this wide of point, takes a single, and Azhar seems to have hurt himself while completing that single
makes room, gets a full ball into the pads, works it away for a single
makes room, drives this inside-out, gets a single to sweeper-cover
flat, shortish, punched away for a single to the left of sweeper-cover
length ball, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for a single
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for a single
length ball, on off, played inside-out for a single to long-off
short of a length, holding its line in front of off, played with an open face, to point where Dilshan has come back after having stayed away with a suspected hairline fracture on one of the fingers
length ball outside off, crisply driven to extra cover
Azhar shifts from first gear to fifth. Walks down the wicket, and inside the line, and lofts this length ball over square leg for a six. Just clears the rope. Target in two figures now
length ball outside off, pushed with an open face to point
short of a length, cutting away, steered down to third man for a single
short of a length, wide, slashed away towards third man for a single
full toss on the pads, clipped wide of deep square leg, the partnership crossed 100, Misbah reaches 50
yorker, outside off, dug out back to Malinga
half-volley on off, driven nicely, but finds mid-off
short and wide, cut away to third man for one. A slower ball gone wrong
slower ball, on a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
full, middle and leg, swinging in, placed wide of deep square, puts pressure on Thirimanne, who is running in, and the fumble allows an easy second
length ball, holds its line just outside off, driven straight to cover
walks down the wicket, converts this into a half-volley, drives it to long-on for one
half-volley outside off, 124ks, driven solidly to the left of mid-off, but not wide enough of him
full toss on the pads, Misbah doesn't need a second invitation, and flicks this over midwicket for four
near yorker, dug out to mid-off

Chaos. Walks across the stumps, pushes a full ball to point, and turns down the single. This is Azhar's call, he is running towards the danger end, and Misbah should just respond to him. He doesn't. Azhar runs up 60% of the way, then runs back. Changes the direction while running too. So he was a goner even if the throw has hit him. What's more? Azhar seems to have pulled a calf muscle as he dives. Or is it a cramp? Only saving grace for Pakistan is, that the throw from point has missed
slower ball, full toss on the pads, misses out as he deflects this straight to short fine leg, where Weerakoon misfields to allow a couple
length ball, swinging into the pads, clipped away for a single

against the run of play, Misbah has holed out. This is not over by a long way. What an effort from Kulasekara at mid-off. His two catches today, put against Gul's fielding, could be the difference tonight. Length ball from Malinga, Misbah camps back, opens up the stance slightly, and smashes it down the ground. It goes uppishly, to the right of mid-off, where Kulasekara completes a solid catch. This is timed perfectly, mind you. Superb anticipation from Kula
that's a lovely welcome from Malinga. Short, sharp, over middle and leg. Akmal ducks under it
short again, 142ks, and this stays low too. Akmal stays outside the line of this. Business is picking up
another bouncer, the sharpest of the three. Over the stumps too. No room. Akmal stays outside the line again
slower ball, big change-up, 98ks, but bowled down the leg side, and called wide
driven straight to extra cover. There have been a few of those
another slower ball at 101ks, and another wide down the leg side
another crisp drive straight to a fielder, this time to mid-off. This will frustrate the batsmen
down the track, ends up yorking himself, Dilshan fields at point, and grimaces as he collects the ball. He seems have a hairline fracture. Didn't field at point at the start of the innings

Kulasekara is everywhere. Smashing catches, and then a wicket. Loose from Akmal. Rattled by those bouncers from Malinga? Perhaps. This is a length ball outside off, Akmal doesn;t get close to it and drives. The ball holds its line, and takes a healthy edge through to Sanga
length ball, no room, YK is forward and defending
on a length, no room, defended back to him. Sri Lanka are well and truly back in this one

slower ball outside off, and for the third time in the last two overs, Azhar has missed a boundary by a matter of a few feet. Glides this with an open face, the there is no deep point, but he finds Dilshan at backward point
bouncer at 141ks, wided down the leg side. Not too far down leg, I tell you. Mahela is not a fan of this call, and lets the umpires know
this is a much better bouncer, aimed straight at the coconut, Azhar is down on the ground as he stays away from its line. Mahela and Sanga applaud. Letting the batsman know pressure is on
short, into the chest, Azhar is late into the pull, but the top edge clears a leaping Sanga. Is this the break Pakistan need?
plays the upper-cut, and luckily for him Azhar has not connected well as this falls short of third man
slower ball, outside off, runs it down to third man for a single

Run-out missed by Sri Lanka. Pushed to point. Azhar starts the single, realises later that he is limping and won't be able to make it. YK shakes his hand, and runs back. And because Malinga is not back at the stumps, the throw from point is a lob for the mid-on to run in and collect. Younis makes it in by a frame. Had Malinga been back, Younis was a goner
length ball, outside off, pushed to cover, says no to a single

Gone. That man Perera again. Younis shuffles across the crease, Perera doesn;t lose his line, bowls short of a length, just outside off. YK tries to run it down, gets an edge, is caught by Snaga, and he walks off. This one just about held its line

and this is an Afridi special. It goes with the Afridi territory. Short of a length, just outside off, and he goes hard at the first ball he plays. Doesn't quite come on to the bat as well as he expects it to, and ends up lobbing it straight to short cover. Perera on a hat-trick

Perera has the hat-trick. The roof has come off the Premedasa stands. Jayawardene comes in at wide slip for the hat-trick ball. Perera bowls short of a length, just outside off, and Sarf pushes at it away from the body. The edge goes low to the left of Mahela, but the captain doesn't let his star allrounder down
length ball, middle and leg, defended

Perera is causing havoc out there. Pakistan are combusting out there. This man could fly and save kids from natural disasters tonight. Short of a length, into the body, hits the rib area, Azhar wants a leg-bye, then realises he is limping, and won't be able to make it. Sends Tanvir back. Perera fields, is air borne, and flicks it underarm, direct onto the stumps. This game is over
bowls a wide full toss down leg
Azhar walks down, swings at a length ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad, takes the single
length ball, wide down the leg side

now it's the other half of the Josephian Mafia. Short of a length, outside off, not doing much, Gul pushes at it, edges, and Sanga dives low to his right to complete the catch. End of a horrible night for Gul
length ball, on off, defended to cover
length ball outside off, driven to mid-off for one
Azhar dances down and pulls this to long-on for one
length ball, into the pads, worked away, and now Azhar turns down the single to farm the strike. A noble effort from Azhar, but this is not going to work unless you are a Lance Klusener
makes room, toe-ends a short-of-a-length delivery to long-on for one
short, pulled away to deep square for one
looks to cut this in the air, over point, toe-ends it again, and gets a single as it doesn't carry to third man
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
slower ball gone wrong, wide down the leg side
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, middle and leg, placed between deep square and fine leg, and Azhar limps back for the second
length ball outside off, placed straight to point
slower ball, half-volley on the pads, he clips it down to long-on for one
slower ball again, on off, stays back to defend
short, outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
length, on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
driven down the ground, Malinga gets a foot to it, and concedes just the single
lovely shot. Ajmal showing his specialist batsmen how it is done. Length ball outside off, and he goes inside-out, and over extra cover
wide length ball again, but this time he finds sweeper-cover with the drive
slower-ball full toss, swiped across for a single
length ball outside off, takes a thin edge on the drive, falls short of the keeper
short and wide, pulled away nicely, but finds midwicket, the only man inside the circle on the leg side
and Sri Lanka are still diving and urgent. Bowled cross-seam, stops at him, and Ajmal lobs this towards mid-off. Thirimanne dives in front, and takes a low catch to finish this off
